subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Friday, 18 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




New Wembley rolls out red carpet
Wembley will stage a star-studded opening ceremony before Saturday's FA Cup final between Chelsea and Man Utd.



 
Ferguson fears Wembley shoot-out
Man Utd manager Sir Alex Ferguson dreads the FA Cup final going to penalties.



 
Cup final referee wary of diving
Referee Steve Bennett admits it will be a difficult task to spot incidents of diving in the FA Cup final.








GOLF




Irish Open leaderboard
The latest scores from the European Tour event at Adare Manor.



 
Dyson shares lead in Irish Open
England's Simon Dyson shoots a 68 which leaves him in a four-strong group at the top of the Irish Open leaderboard.



 
Irish Open hit by lure of US Tour
Graeme McDowell says events such as this week's Irish Open are suffering because of the US Tour's strength.








MOTORSPORT




Mosley steps up push for green F1
Formula One boss Max Mosley is proposing a raft of changes to help accelerate the adoption of "green" technology.



 
Rally of Italy positions
Leading positions from the World Rally Championship event.



 
Hamilton won't win title - Jordan
Former team boss Eddie Jordan says Lewis Hamilton is an "extraordinary talent" but will not be world champion this year.








FORMULA ONE




Mosley steps up push for green F1
Formula One boss Max Mosley is proposing a raft of changes to help accelerate the adoption of "green" technology.



 
Hamilton won't win title - Jordan
Former team boss Eddie Jordan says Lewis Hamilton is an "extraordinary talent" but will not be world champion this year.



 
Hamilton will set 'new standards'
Lewis Hamilton will "create the new benchmark for Formula One", according to three-time champion Jackie Stewart.








ATHLETICS




UK to host landmark running event
The first-ever Commonwealth ultra running championships will be held in the UK in 2009.



 
Kenya star denied Manchester visa
World half-marathon record holder Sammy Wanjiru will miss Sunday's Great Manchester Run after failing to obtain a visa.



 
Sprint stars set for Loughborough
Three of the British squad that won the Olympic 4x100m gold in 2004 will compete at the Loughborough International on Sunday.








CYCLING




Blackmail claim stuns Landis case
Floyd Landis sacks his business manager after he allegedly tried to expose the fact Greg LeMond had been a victim of child abuse.



 
Laverde grabs Giro stage victory
Colombia's Luis Felipe Laverde wins the sixth stage of the Giro d'Italia from Tivoli to Spoleto.



 
Foerster races to Giro stage win
Robert Foerster wins stage five of the Giro d'Italia but Danilo Di Luca retains the overall lead.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Movie legend to strip if team go up, as the hunt for Mourinho's dog goes on



 
KP's rough guide to Britain
Listen to Pietersen spoof on new Radio 4 show Look Away Now



 
Comment: Blues up for the Cup
Robbo backs Chelsea, providing there are no more dog dramas
